meanings.definition: The act of giving something the appearance of bronze.
meanings.sent1: She applied bronzing powder to her cheeks for a shimmery look.
meanings.sent2: The artist's bronzing of the statue made it look like real bronze.
meanings.sent3: The bronzing of the toy car made it seem like a tiny treasure.
meanings.sent4: The bronzing of the key turned it into a magical artifact.
meanings.sent5: The bronzing of the frame added a touch of elegance to the painting.

meanings.definition: The process of becoming tan or golden in color.
meanings.sent1: After a day at the beach, her bronzing was evident on her skin.
meanings.sent2: His bronzing from working outdoors gave him a healthy glow.
meanings.sent3: The bronzing from the sun made her look like a golden goddess.
meanings.sent4: The bronzing of the leaves in autumn painted the landscape in warm hues.
meanings.sent5: The bronzing of the bread crust gave it a deliciously crispy texture.

meanings.definition: A substance used to give a bronze-like finish to an object.
meanings.sent1: The artist applied a special bronzing to the sculpture for a metallic look.
meanings.sent2: The bronzing used on the antique mirror restored its original shine.
meanings.sent3: The bronzing on the old clock made it look like a valuable antique.
meanings.sent4: The bronzing on the jewelry box gave it a luxurious appearance.
meanings.sent5: The bronzing on the doorknob made it stand out as a unique piece.
